question.question-text: Why does the man say this:

answer-text.exp: To indicate the next topic for discussion

answer-list.answer-text: To suggest a new location for the discussion
To state what has previously been said
To clarify why they are having the discussion

question.explain-text: The man opens the discussion by saying now, we can move on to discuss the next part of the chapter, the part on land tortoises. From this, it can be determined that the man says this to indicate the next topic for discussion. The first answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: How does the man seem to feel when he says this:
question.explain-text: In the discussion, the woman mentions tortoises that were supposed to be one- to two-hundred years old, and the man responds by saying that couldn't be…No way. From this, it can be determined that the man seems to feel incredulous about what the woman said. The second answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: Why does the woman say this:

answer-list.answer-text: To contradict what was in the book
To indicate that she is not sure what is correct
To restate what the man said

answer-text.exp: To correct an error by the man

question.explain-text: In the discussion, the man says I read that Marion's Tortoise was 152 years old, and the woman responds by saying actually, I think the book said it was at least 152 years old. From this, it can be determined that the woman says this to correct an error by the man. The last answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: What does the man mean when he says this:

answer-list.answer-text: Marion's tortoise was not on the island of Mauritius.
There may be an alternate explanation.
There was only one tortoise on the island.

question.explain-text: In the discussion, the woman says that Marion's tortoise died in 1918, and the man responds by saying how do they know it was the same tortoise? Could it have been a different tortoise? From this, it can be determined that the man means that there may be an alternate explanation. The third answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: Which sentence best describes how the woman feels when she says this:

answer-list.answer-text: It is possible for a tortoise to live for 200 years.
A tortoise could not possibly live to the age of 200.
No 200-year-old tortoise has ever been found.
Many types of tortoises live to be very old.

question.explain-text: In the discussion, the woman says that two hundred years old for this type of tortoise isn't inconceivable. From this, it can be determined that the woman feels that it is possible for a tortoise to live for 200 years. The first answer is therefore the best answer to this question.
